doc: added The Go image package article

Orignally published on The Go Programming Language, September 21, 2011.

http://blog.golang.org/2011/09/go-image-package.html

Update issue 2547

R=adg, nigeltao
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5933049

Committer: Nigel Tao <nigeltao@golang.org>

Hello adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM.

I'll fix up the tiny typo when I submit.

https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/1020/doc/articles/image_package.html
File doc/articles/image_package.html (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/1020/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode205
doc/articles/image_package.html:205: slice of pixel data. For example, an
s/an/a/. English is quirky in places.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/6002/doc/articles/image_package.html File doc/articles/image_package.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/6002/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode177 doc/articles/image_package.html:177: An Image maps every grid square in a why the indent here?

https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html File doc/articles/image_package.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode7 doc/articles/image_package.html:7: Package image defines a number of types: This opening paragraph needs reworking: the image.Color and and image.ColorModel types have been renamed to color.Color and color.Model. I'd replace with: The image and image/color packages define a number of types: color.Color and color.Model describe colors, image.Point and image.Rectangle describe basic 2-D geometry, and image.Image brings the two concepts together to represent a rectangular grid of colors. A separate article covers image composition with the image/draw package. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode55 doc/articles/image_package.html:55: with non-alpha-premultiplied colors, which is why color.Color uses You sometimes call things color.Foo, and other times just Foo. I would just always call them Foo, so: s/color.Color/Color/ The opening paragraph above is the exception to this rule. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode60 doc/articles/image_package.html:60: The image package also defines a number of concrete color types that implement s,image,image/color, and then s/concrete color types/concrete types/ reads better. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode62 doc/articles/image_package.html:62: color.RGBA is a struct that s/color.RGBA/RGBA/ https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode73 doc/articles/image_package.html:73: color.NRGBA struct type represents s/color.NRGBA/NRGBA/ https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode81 doc/articles/image_package.html:81: A color.Model is simply s/color.Model/Model/. Similarly in this paragraph for color.Gray and color.Palette. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode82 doc/articles/image_package.html:82: something that can convert Colors to other Colors, possibly lossily. For The "Color"s should be "Color". https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode117 doc/articles/image_package.html:117: out their Min and Max Points. Points should be Points. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode223 doc/articles/image_package.html:223: These types also provide a Set(x, y int, c Color) method that s/Color/color.Color/ This is actual code, so the distinction matters. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/articles/image_package.html#newcode300 doc/articles/image_package.html:300: _ "vp8-go.googlecode.com/hg/webp" Change the import path to "code.google.com/p/vp8-go/webp" and move it up one line, to maintain sortedness. https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/progs/image_package5.go File doc/progs/image_package5.go (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/5933049/diff/4/doc/progs/image_package5.go#newcode16 doc/progs/image_package5.go:16: I'd delete the blank line.
